intro: Metrosideros patens, commonly known as the New Zealand Christmas tree, is a small evergreen shrub or tree native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its distinctive red, urn-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are dark green and glossy on top, with a lighter, sometimes whitish underside. It thrives in coastal and subalpine environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. The species is also known for its ornamental value and is cultivated in gardens around the world.
